title: Romelu Lukaku ranked alongside Marco van Basten and even Johan Cruyff by his Everton boss Ronald Koeman
text:
Sport Romelu Lukaku ranked alongside Marco van Basten and even Johan Cruyff by his Everton boss Ronald Koeman "He’s one of the best, even comparing him to players in my time. He is world class in his finishing" Share Lukaku's four-goal blitz of Bournemouth last weekend gives him 16 in the league this season (Photo: Getty) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Ronald Koeman believes Romelu Lukaku is as good a finisher as Marco van Basten and Johan Cruyff. 
The Everton boss played alongside greats such as Ruud Gullit, Van Basten and under the late Cruyff - but believes that in front of goal at least, his Goodison forward is the equal of them all. 
And with Lukaku’s agent suggesting the Belgium international is close to agreeing a contact extension to keep him at the club, Koeman believes they are about to secure a world class talent to a long term future with the Blues. 
“Yes he’s one of the best, even comparing him to the players in my time. He is world class in his finishing,” the Holland legend said. Koeman hopes the rest of Lukaku's game one day matches his quality in front of goal (Photo: PA) 
“He really is that good, although he needs to improve in a total picture as a player – but that part of him is world class. We know if we give him the chances, normally he will score the goals.” 
Unlike his excitable predecessor Roberto Martinez, Koeman is not a manager prone to exaggeration, and he generally prefers to help players improve their weaknesses, rather than massage their egos. 
Yet he has no hesitation in comparing Lukaku to the stars of the greatest Dutch team of them all, the side that won the 1988 Euros, led by Van Basten, and typified by THAT audacious volley against Russia in the final. The football world united to mourn Dutch legend Cruyff last year (Photo: Getty Images) Van Basten scored one of the greatest goals ever at the 1988 European Championship (Photo: Getty) Read More Koeman plays down Barcelona talk and reaffirms his commitment to Everton 
The Everton manager’s only hesitation comes when confirming the suggestion from the striker’s agent Mino Raiola that “talks are ongoing and he WILL sign”, with a cautious Koeman suggesting he is merely hopeful of that outcome. 
“I don’t believe agents, so I don’t know. I wouldn’t say anything now but maybe after the weekend yes. It’s no issue for now - playing on Saturday is more important. 
“But that is really good and important for the club, for the team and for me because at the moment it means we can keep the best players and he has seen a future in this club. That is really positive.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
